sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均有"对手，敌手"之意。
means: opponent ： 最常用词，通常指在争论、辩论、竞选或竞赛以及其它各种矛盾冲突中站在对立面的"对手"或"敌手"。
competitor ： 指为同一目标或目的竞争者，一般无感情色彩。
enemy ： 多指充满敌意的仇敌。
foe ： 语气较强，多用于书面文字和诗歌中。指不仅敌对，而且很危险，怀有很深的敌意。
rival ： 指与某人目标一致而想赶上或超过他的人，匹敌者。

sentence.Network_en: Young and old saw in him an implacable opponent of apartheid.
sentence.Network_cn: 无论老少都看出他是种族隔离制度的坚决反对者。

sentence.Network_en: The president put the blame squarely on his opponent.
sentence.Network_cn: 总统将责任完全归咎于对手。

sentence.Network_en: He's the best opponent I've come across this season, a great player.
sentence.Network_cn: 他是我本赛季遇到的最出色的对手，一位了不起的运动员。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 16th cent. (denoting a person opening an academic debate by proposing objections to a philosophical or religious thesis): from Latin opponent- 'setting against', from the verb opponere, from ob- 'against' + ponere 'place'

entry.def: A politician's opponents are other politicians who belong to a different party or who have different aims or policies.

example.ex: ...Mr Kennedy's opponent in the leadership contest...
example.tran: 与肯尼迪先生争夺领导权的对手

example.ex: He described the detention without trial of political opponents as a cowardly act.
example.tran: 他称未经审判就将政敌关押起来是懦夫之举。

entry.def: In a sporting contest, your opponent is the person who is playing against you.

example.ex: Norris twice knocked down his opponent in the early rounds of the fight...
example.tran: 诺里斯在前几个回合中两次击倒对手。

example.ex: He's the best opponent I've come across this season, a great player.
example.tran: 他是我本赛季遇到的最出色的对手，一位了不起的运动员。

entry.def: The opponents of an idea or policy do not agree with it and do not want it to be carried out.

example.ex: ...opponents of the spread of nuclear weapons...
example.tran: 反对核武器扩散的人士

example.ex: He became an outspoken opponent of the old Soviet system.
example.tran: 他成为旧的苏联体制直言不讳的抨击者。

means.word_mean: 1. a contestant that you are matched against

auth_sentence.content: It was a good victory against a good opponent.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: It was a good victory against a good opponent.

auth_sentence.content: My opponent seems to have dropped from the sky.

auth_sentence.res_content: Better accepted as a friend...than as a formidable opponent.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Better accepted as a friend...than as a formidable opponent.

stems_affixes.word_buile: com共同+pon放+ent……的→放到一起[的东西]→成分
com共同+pon放+ent……的→放到一起[的东西]→成分
ex出+pon放置+ent人→把内容放出来的人→说明者
op反+pon放置+ent人→n.对手,反对者,敌手
propone[v.提议,建议,陈述]+ent人→n.提议者,支持者,拥护者
pro向前+pon放置+e→把[意见]向前放→提议

Sentence.sentence: Several opponents have recently emerged, ranging from rival tech giants such as Microsoft and Amazon to small bodies representing authors and publishers across the world.
In broad terms, these opponents have levelled two sets of criticisms at Google
Opponents of Google Books believe that digitally archiving the world's books should be controlled by non-profit organisations .

sentences.en: He beat his opponent in the election.
sentences.cn: 他在选举中击败了对手。

sentences.en: She is one of the strongest opponents of tax reform.
sentences.cn: 她是税收改革的最强烈的反对者之一。

jushi.english: She is one of the strongest opponents of tax reform.
jushi.chinese: 她是税收改革最强烈的反对者之一。

jushi.english: He beat his opponent in the election.
jushi.chinese: 他在选举中击败了对手。
